required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in Germany (LIFE-C)
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in Germany (LIFE-C)

brief_summary.textblock:
The interferon-free combination regimen of paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) ± ribavirin (RBV) for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC) has been shown to be safe and effective in randomized controlled clinical trials with strict inclusion and exclusion criteria under well controlled conditions.
This observational study is the first effectiveness research examining the ABBVIE REGIMEN ± RBV, used according to local label, under real world conditions in Germany in a clinical practice patient population.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 is defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) ribonucleic acid (RNA) less than the lower limit of quantification (< 50 IU/mL) 12 weeks after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virological Response at End of Treatment (EoTR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: EoT, (treatment period was 12 weeks or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Virological response is defined as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL. End of Treatment (EoT) is defined as the last intake of ABBVIE REGIMEN or RBV.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With On-Treatment Virological Failure or Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to post-treatment Week 12 (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants meeting the following SVR12 non-response categories: On-treatment virological failure (breakthrough) defined >= 1 documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA >= 50 IU/mL during treatment or failure to suppress (each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value >= 50 IU/mL) Relapse defined as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at EoT followed by HCV RNA >= 50 IU/mL post-treatment in participants who completed treatment (<= 7 days shortened).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Rapid Virological Response at Week 4 (RVR4)
secondary_outcome.description: RVR4 is defined as participants with HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at Week 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virological Response 24 Weeks After EoT (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 Weeks After EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR24 is defined as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL 24 Weeks After EoT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virological Response 48 Weeks After EoT (SVR48)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 Weeks After EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR48 is defined as participants with HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL 48 weeks after EoT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in PRISM Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 and 48 weeks after EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: PRISM is a visual quantitative method to assess the perceived burden of suffering due to illness. The distance between the center of the "self" (yellow disk) and the illness disk (red disk) is called "self-illness separation" (SIS) and is measured in cm (range is 0 - 27). The smaller the distance, the higher the burden of suffering.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With ≥ 1 Comorbidity and/or Co-Infection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to post-treatment Week 48 (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
up to post-treatment Week 48 (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Duration of of ABBVIE REGIMEN and RBV Taken
secondary_outcome.description: Documented by participant interview and/or participant diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Planned Duration of ABBVIE REGIMEN and RBV Taken
secondary_outcome.description: Planned duration of treatment was 12 or 24 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FACIT-F Scale Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks), 12 and 48 weeks after EoT
secondary_outcome.description: The FACIT-F Scale is a 13-item questionnaire that assesses self-reported fatigue during the past 7 days and its impact upon daily activities and function. Scores range from 0 - 100, with higher scores indicating a lesser degree of fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to EoT in PAM-13 Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: The PAM-13 item scale is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate a higher level of knowledge, skill and confidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in WPAI: Total Work Productivity Impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks),12 and 24 weeks after EoT
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline Over Time in WPAI: Total Activity Impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks),12 and 24 weeks after EoT
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious TEAEs and/or Pregnancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days post treatment (treatment period was 12 weeks or 24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence. If an AE meets any of the following criteria, it is considered serious: results in death, is life threatening, results in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, is a congenital anomaly, results in significant disability/incapacity, or is an important medical event. TEAEs are defined as any reported event that begins or worsens in severity after initiation of study drug through 30 days post-study drug dosing.

arm_group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C (CHC) genotype 1a (G1a, includes all GT1-participants except participants with GT1b or GT1b/4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + ribavirin (RBV) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label. The prescription of a treatment regimen is at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, is made independently from this observational study and precedes the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 1b (G1b; includes G1b/Genotype 4 [G4]), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label. The prescription of a treatment regimen is at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, is made independently from this observational study and precedes the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 4 (G4; non-G1), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label. The prescription of a treatment regimen is at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, is made independently from this observational study and precedes the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment-naïve or -experienced patients with confirmed CHC, genotype 1 or 4, receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free ABBVIE REGIMEN ± RBV according to standard of care and in line with local label.
- If RBV is co-administered with the ABBVIE REGIMEN, it has been prescribed in line with the current local label (with special attention to contraception requirements and contraindication during pregnancy)
- Patients must voluntarily sign and date a patient authorization to use and/or disclose his/her pseudonymized health data prior to inclusion into the study
- Patient must not be participating or intending to participate in a concurrent interventional therapeutic trial
Exclusion Criteria:
• Adolescents; people not treated according to label

participant_flow.recruitment_details: In this prospective, multi-center observational study, adult patients chronic hepatitis C (CHC) virus receiving the interferon-free ABBVIE REGIMEN (paritaprevir/r - ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir) with or without ribavirin (RBV) were offered the opportunity to participate in this study during a routine clinical visit at participating sites.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Per protocol, the Enrolled Population is used to present Participant Flow. Enrolled Population analysis groups are defined according to the participant’s HCV genotype/subtype, regardless of ABBVIE Regimen prescribed.

group.title: Genotype 1a Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C (CHC) genotype 1a (G1a, includes all GT1- participants except participants with GT1b or GT1b/4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + ribavirin (RBV) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 1b Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 1b (G1b; includes G1b/G4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 4 Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 4 (G4; non-G1), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Missing
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC but no genotype information.

baseline.population: Safety Population: all enrolled participants who received ≥1 dose of ABBVIE REGIMEN, grouped according to treatment regimen (actual treatment received). This presentation was necessary for baseline characteristics since some study-specific measures for which Baseline data are required were analyzed only according to actual treatment received.

group.title: 2 DAA+RBV
group.description: Two direct-acting antivirals (2DAA): paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) plus RBV

group.title: 3DAA
group.description: Three direct-acting antivirals (3DAA): paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir + dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN)

group.title: 3DAA+RBV
group.description: 3DAA: paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir + dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) plus RBV

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Pictorial Representation of Illness and Self-Measure (PRISM) Tool
measure.description: PRISM is a visual quantitative method to assess the perceived burden of suffering due to illness. The distance between the center of the “self” (yellow disk) and the illness disk (red disk) is called “self-illness separation” (SIS) and is measured in cm (range is 0 - 27). The smaller the distance, the higher the burden of suffering.
measure.population: participants with a Baseline assessment

measure.title: Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-F) Scale
measure.description: The FACIT-F Scale is a 13-item questionnaire that assesses self-reported fatigue during the past 7 days and its impact upon daily activities and function. Scores range from 0 - 100, with higher scores indicating a lesser degree of fatigue.
measure.population: participants with a Baseline assessment

measure.title: Patient Activation Measure (PAM-13) Questionnaire
measure.description: The PAM-13 item scale is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate and higher level of knowledge, skill and confidence.
measure.population: participants with a Baseline assessment

measure.title: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Work Productivity Impairment
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.
measure.population: participants with a Baseline assessment

measure.title: WPAI: Total Activity Impairment
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.
measure.population: participants with a Baseline assessment

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR12)
outcome.description: SVR12 is defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) ribonucleic acid (RNA) less than the lower limit of quantification (< 50 IU/mL) 12 weeks after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN.
outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
outcome.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype; the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known) with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR12.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 1 or 4, receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) ± RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label

group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC G1a (includes all GT1-participants except participants with GT1b or GT1b/4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 1b Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 1b (G1b; includes G1b/G4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 4 Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 4 (G4; non-G1), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

measure.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype; the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known) with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR12.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With On-Treatment Virological Failure or Relapse
outcome.description: The number of participants meeting the following SVR12 non-response categories: On-treatment virological failure (breakthrough) defined >= 1 documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA >= 50 IU/mL during treatment or failure to suppress (each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value >= 50 IU/mL) Relapse defined as HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at EoT followed by HCV RNA >= 50 IU/mL post-treatment in participants who completed treatment (<= 7 days shortened).

Participants with non-response 12 weeks after EoT.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virological Response 48 Weeks After EoT (SVR48)
measure.description: SVR48 is defined as participants with HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL 48 weeks after EoT.
measure.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype; the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known) with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR48.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in PRISM Over Time
outcome.description: PRISM is a visual quantitative method to assess the perceived burden of suffering due to illness. The distance between the center of the "self" (yellow disk) and the illness disk (red disk) is called "self-illness separation" (SIS) and is measured in cm (range is 0 - 27). The smaller the distance, the higher the burden of suffering.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 12 and 48 weeks after EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)
outcome.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype; the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). Participants with a measurement at given time point.

measure.description: PRISM is a visual quantitative method to assess the perceived burden of suffering due to illness. The distance between the center of the "self" (yellow disk) and the illness disk (red disk) is called "self-illness separation" (SIS) and is measured in cm (range is 0 - 27). The smaller the distance, the higher the burden of suffering.

outcome.time_frame: up to post-treatment Week 48 (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks)

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C (CHC), genotype 1 or 4, receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) ± ribavirin (RBV) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 1 Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 1, receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) ± RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 1a Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC G1a (includes all GT1-participants except participants with GT1b or GT1b/4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 1b Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 1b (G1b; includes G1b/G4), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir with dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

group.title: Genotype 4 Participants
group.description: Treatment-naïve or -experienced participants with confirmed CHC genotype 4 (G4; non-G1), receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in FACIT-F Scale Over Time
outcome.description: The FACIT-F Scale is a 13-item questionnaire that assesses self-reported fatigue during the past 7 days and its impact upon daily activities and function. Scores range from 0 - 100, with higher scores indicating a lesser degree of fatigue.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks), 12 and 48 weeks after EoT
outcome.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype; the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). Participants with a measurement at given time point.

outcome.description: The PAM-13 item scale is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate a higher level of knowledge, skill and confidence.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline Over Time in WPAI: Total Work Productivity Impairment
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, EoT (treatment period was 12 or 24 weeks),12 and 24 weeks after EoT
outcome.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). Overall: participants with a measurement at Baseline; data rows = participants with a measurement at Baseline and given time point.

measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline Over Time in WPAI: Total Activity Impairment
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.

outcome.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). measure.title: Change From Baseline Over Time in WPAI: Total Activity Impairment
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.
measure.population: Core Population: Participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). Overall: participants with a measurement at Baseline; data rows = participants with a measurement at Baseline and given time point.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious TEAEs and/or Pregnancies
outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence. If an AE meets any of the following criteria, it is considered serious: results in death, is life threatening, results in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, is a congenital anomaly, results in significant disability/incapacity, or is an important medical event. TEAEs are defined as any reported event that begins or worsens in severity after initiation of study drug through 30 days post-study drug dosing.
outcome.time_frame: up to 30 days post treatment (treatment period was 12 weeks or 24 weeks)
outcome.population: Safety Population: all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN (the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). Pregnancy data presented for female participants only.

group.title: Total
group.description: 2DAA: paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) plus RBV or 3DAA: paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir + dasabuvir [ABBVIE REGIMEN]) or 3DAA: paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir + dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV

group.title: 2 DAA+RBV
group.description: Two direct-acting antivirals (2DAA): paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) plus RBV

group.title: 3DAA
group.description: Three direct-acting antivirals (3DAA): paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir + dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN)

group.title: 3DAA+RBV
group.description: 3DAA: paritaprevir/ritonavir – ombitasvir + dasabuvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) + RBV

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), Serious TEAEs and/or Pregnancies
measure.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence. If an AE meets any of the following criteria, it is considered serious: results in death, is life threatening, results in hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, is a congenital anomaly, results in significant disability/incapacity, or is an important medical event. TEAEs are defined as any reported event that begins or worsens in severity after initiation of study drug through 30 days post-study drug dosing.
measure.population: Safety Population: all enrolled participants who received at least one dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN (the prescribed ABBVIE REGIMEN was known). Pregnancy data presented for female participants only.

reported_events.time_frame: up to 30 days post treatment (treatment period was 12 weeks or 24 weeks)
reported_events.desc: Treatment-emergent AEs are presented. Treatment-emergent AEs are defined as any reported AE that begins or worsens in severity after initiation of study drug through 30 days after last study drug intake. Treatment duration was not a factor for assignment to reporting groups.

group.title: 2 DAA+RBV
group.description: 2DAA: paritaprevir/ritonavir - ombitasvir (ABBVIE REGIMEN) plus RBV

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: AbbVie requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. AbbVie requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if AbbVie needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.
